dt: {bc}to make known the opinions or feelings of (oneself)
{bc}to give {a_link|expression} to the artistic or creative impulses or abilities of (oneself)
{bc}to give or convey a true impression of {bc}{sx|show||}, {sx|reflect||}
{bc}to represent by a sign or symbol {bc}{sx|symbolize||}
{bc}to force out (something, such as the juice of a fruit) by pressure
{bc}to subject to pressure so as to extract something
{bc}to cause (a gene) to manifest its effects in the phenotype
{bc}to manifest or produce (a character, molecule, or effect) by a genetic process

pt: {sc}express{/sc} {sc}vent{/sc} {sc}utter{/sc} {sc}voice{/sc} {sc}broach{/sc} {sc}air{/sc} mean to make known what one thinks or feels. {sc}express{/sc} suggests an impulse to reveal in words, gestures, actions, or what one creates or produces.
{sc}vent{/sc} stresses a strong inner compulsion to express especially in words.
{sc}utter{/sc} implies the use of the voice not necessarily in articulate speech.
{sc}voice{/sc} does not necessarily imply vocal utterance but does imply expression or formulation in words.
{sc}broach{/sc} adds the implication of disclosing for the first time something long thought over or reserved for a suitable occasion.
{sc}air{/sc} implies an exposing or parading of one's views often in order to gain relief or sympathy or attention.

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French & Latin; Anglo-French {it}espresser{/it}, from {it}expres{/it}, adjective
shortdef: to make known the opinions or feelings of (oneself)
to give expression to the artistic or creative impulses or abilities of (oneself)

dt: {bc}designed for or adapted to its purpose
{bc}traveling with few or no stops along the way
{bc}designed or intended to be used for fast movement or travel

dt.t: an {wi}express{/wi} highway with few local exits

dt: {bc}designated to be delivered without delay by special messenger

pt: {sc}explicit{/sc} {sc}definite{/sc} {sc}express{/sc} {sc}specific{/sc} mean perfectly clear in meaning. {sc}explicit{/sc} implies such verbal plainness and distinctness that there is no need for inference and no room for difficulty in understanding.
{sc}definite{/sc} stresses precise, clear statement or arrangement that leaves no doubt or indecision.

pt.t: the law is {it}definite{/it} in such cases

pt: {sc}express{/sc} implies both explicitness and direct and positive utterance.
{sc}specific{/sc} applies to what is precisely and fully treated in detail or particular.

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}expres{/it}, from Latin {it}expressus{/it}, past participle of {it}exprimere{/it} to press out, express, from {it}ex-{/it} + {it}premere{/it} to press {ma}{mat|press|}{/ma}

dt: {bc}a system for the prompt and safe transportation of parcels, money, or goods at rates higher than standard freight charges
{bc}a company operating such a merchandise freight service
{bc}a messenger sent on a special errand
{bc}a dispatch conveyed by a special messenger

shortdef: a system for the prompt and safe transportation of parcels, money, or goods at rates higher than standard freight charges
a company operating such a merchandise freight service
a messenger sent on a special errand

dt: used for overnight delivery of mail
{bc}to become known or seen as the result of a particular action

dt.t: His rage and frustration {it}expressed themselves{/it} as/in/through temper tantrums.

shortdef: to become known or seen as the result of a particular action

dt: {bc}an area in a store (such as a supermarket) where customers form a line that lets them pay for the things they are buying more quickly than other lanes

dt.t: Customers with fewer than 12 items can use the {it}express lane{/it}.

shortdef: an area in a store (such as a supermarket) where customers form a line that lets them pay for the things they are buying more quickly than other lanes

dt: {bc}to say or show one's thoughts and feelings

dt.t: He has a hard time {it}expressing himself{/it}.
She felt that she hadn't {it}expressed herself{/it} correctly.

shortdef: to say or show one's thoughts and feelings

dt: {bc}a train that has very few stops

shortdef: a train that has very few stops

dt: {bc}a rapid postal and express system that operated across the western U.S. in 1860–61 by relays of horses and riders

shortdef: a rapid postal and express system that operated across the western U.S. in 1860—61 by relays of horses and riders
